intro: Pilosella irrubescens, commonly known as the red-stemmed globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and small, yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, wind-dispersed seeds. Pilosella irrubescens is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its adaptability and ability to stabilize soil.
